content.rendered:
What is a Pharmacy Technician?

Pharmacy Technicians assist Pharmacists in dispensing prescriptions to customers and other health professionals. 

Where does a Pharmacy Technician work?

  • Pharmacies
  • Hospitals
  • Stores where pharmacies are located (drug stores, grocery stores)

How much does a Pharmacy Technician make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Pharmacy Technician is $33,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Pharmacy Technicians?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Chemistry majors
  • Biology majors
  • Physics majors
Search Pharmacy Technician jobs on Handshake

Pharmacy Technician skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Pharmacy Technicians succeed in their work:

  • Great customer service skills
  • Strong active listening skills
  • Multi-tasking skills

What are some common questions about Pharmacy Technicians?

Q: How long does it take to become a certified Pharmacy Technician?

A: Depending on the program you’re thinking about, it can take anywhere from 15 weeks to 2 years.
